benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Retrieve payment tags

covered: Valid GET requests: happy path and many valid parameter combinations are covered (no params, includedDeleted=true, pluginProperty repeated entries, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, and combined parameters).
Error responses: 400 (invalid paymentId, invalid audit value), 404 (payment not found), 401 (missing authentication), 500 (internal error), and 503 (dependency down) are exercised.
Empty responses: payment with no tags and empty-database scenarios are present.
Security: SQL injection and XSS negative tests are included.
Edge/performance: large payload and heavy-load performance scenarios are included, plus maximum pluginProperty entries and retry-on-transient-network scenarios.
Regression/backward-compatibility: regression test for includedDeleted behavior and a backward-compatibility scenario for Tag schema are included.
Query-parameter robustness: extra/unexpected query parameters being ignored is tested.
Integration: dependent tag-service outage is tested (503), and pluginProperty processing is acknowledged in tests.
gaps: Pagination: No tests address pagination (limit/offset/page) or verify behavior when dataset is split across pages; guideline expects pagination checks for large datasets.
Caching behavior: No tests for HTTP caching headers or conditional requests (ETag, Cache-Control, If-None-Match/304 behavior).
Rate limiting/throttling: No tests for rate limits or 429 responses under request bursts.
Authorization granularity: Only missing-auth (401) is tested; there is no test for authenticated-but-unauthorized access (403) or role-based permission checks.
Schema-level validation: Tag object fields, types, and required properties are not validated against the Tag definition (field-level assertions missing).
Query-parameter validation gaps: invalid includedDeleted values (non-boolean), malformed/oversized pluginProperty values, and boundary/case-sensitivity checks for audit values are not covered.
Content-Type / headers consistency: Content-Type is explicitly checked in only one scenario; other success/error responses do not uniformly assert headers or charset.
Concurrency/race conditions: No tests simulate concurrent tag modifications (add/delete) during retrieval to check for consistency or atomicity.
PluginProperty end-to-end verification: Tests state plugin properties should be processed but do not validate actual plugin behavior or side effects (mocked vs real-plugin contract test missing).
HTTP method and contract tests: No tests that other HTTP methods return 405 or that the API contract (OpenAPI/JSON Schema) is enforced by automated contract tests.
recommendations: Add pagination tests or explicitly assert that the endpoint does not support pagination; if it does, test limit/offset/page parameters and correct navigation across pages.
Add caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, and test conditional GETs (If-None-Match) returning 304 when content is unchanged.
Implement rate-limiting tests that simulate request bursts and assert 429 or throttling behavior and appropriate Retry-After headers.
Add authorization tests for authenticated but unauthorized users (expect 403) and role-based access checks.
Introduce strict schema validation tests against the Tag definition for all successful responses (check required fields, types, and expected values).

Cover query-parameter validation: test includedDeleted with invalid values, oversized or malformed pluginProperty values, and boundary/case tests for audit parameter (including audit=NONE and case variants).
Assert Content-Type and other relevant response headers (e.g., charset, Cache-Control) in all success and error scenarios, not just one case.
Add concurrency tests to simulate tags being added/removed during retrieval and assert deterministic behavior or documented eventual consistency.
Create end-to-end integration tests (or well-defined mocks) that validate pluginProperty processing results and side effects, and include contract tests between the API and plugin layer.
Add method-not-allowed (405) tests for unsupported HTTP verbs, and include automated contract tests (OpenAPI/JSON Schema) to prevent regressions.
